content.description: Start inside the cave about 4 ft in to the right. Two hand start on most obvious overhanging hold (it's well chalked).  Continue out to the lower right area of cave entrance and stay low with hands while moving to the lower left of cave entrance. My finish was a prominent hold to the left of entrance where I could firmly place two hands with relatively good footing. There is also an obvious top out variation that's still in the V3-category.
content.protection: Its so low that its fairly safe without crash pads but they are advised.

content.description: Start on right side of lower rock formation and traverse left along obvious upper jug.  Lower crack provides secure feet.  Top out is slightly around the left side but be aware some rocks may be loose.
content.location: Climb overtop the cave from right to left.

content.description: Sit start using the lower crack with sloping handholds.  Lay back and find foot holds inside the cave.  Traverse the cave opening by swiveling your hips to find footholds on lower left side of cave wall.  Proceed to obvious top out.
content.location: Sit start on the lower right side of the cave

content.description: Sit start where the left side of the cave meets the ground, not in the cave but on the outside as it begins to wrap around the corner. Traverse right over the opening of the cave. At some point you'll need to switch feet from one side to the other while your hands are towards the center of the top of the "rainbow" arch. Continue the traverse until you're fully to the right of the arch, then follow the crack up to the top edge of the rock (top rock is a bit dirty / overgrown), and follow that edge back over the cave until you're fully wrapped around the left side of the rock formation.
content.protection: Have your spotter move your crashpad, especially as you traverse the first rainbow move under the arch since you'll likely be horizontal.

content.description: This boulder is located on the hill about 50 yards to the west of Forbidden Drive and Wissahickon creek.  It is just northwest of where the yellow trail intersects with Forbidden Drive.  Hidden by foliage most of the year and adorned with some unsightly spray paint.  There is a small cave underneath the rock formation which was supposedly excavated by gold prospectors in the 1760's.
